articles.author: Crispian Balmer, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Following a deal to end more than a year of fighting between Israel and Lebanon's Hezbollah, attention has swung back to the battered Gaza Strip, but any hopes of a rapid end to the war there look likely to be dashed.
articles.title: No expectations of a swift deal for Gaza after Lebanon ceasefire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel will gradually withdraw its forces over 60 days as Lebanon's army takes control of territory near its border with Israel to ensure that Hezbollah does not rebuild its infrastructure there.
articles.title: Israel-Hezbollah ceasefire, brokered by US and France, aims for permanent peace

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A panel of three judges will now decide if they agree there are "reasonable grounds" to believe general Min Aung Hlaing bears criminal responsibility for the deportation and persecution of Rohingya in Myanmar and Bangladesh.
articles.title: International Criminal Court prosecutor seeks arrest warrant for Myanmar military leader

articles.author: Emilie Madi, Haider Kadhim, Ahmad Fahmy
articles.description: The cars began lining up at daybreak, snaking their way slowly through narrow lanes lined with collapsed buildings. A truce had finally ended hostilities between Israel and Hezbollah, and residents of Beirut's suburbs were itching to go home.
articles.title: Amid mass destruction, displaced Lebanese rush home after ceasefire

articles.author: Charlotte Greenfield, Mushtaq Ali
articles.description: The party of Pakistan's jailed former Prime Minister Imran Khan suspended street protests seeking his release, it said on Wednesday, following media reports of hundreds of arrests by security forces in a sweeping midnight raid in the capital.
articles.title: Supporters of Pakistan's Imran Khan call off protest, his party says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States has brokered the release of three Americans in a deal with China that includes the exchange of unidentified Chinese citizens being held in the U.S., Politico reported on Wednesday citing an unnamed Biden administration official.
articles.title: US brokers release of three Americans imprisoned in China, Politico reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Biden administration is pushing ahead with a $680 million arms sales package to Israel, a U.S. official familiar with the plan said on Wednesday, even as a U.S.-brokered ceasefire in Lebanon between Israel and Hezbollah has come into effect.
articles.title: Biden administration planning $680 million arms sale to Israel - source

articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Timour Azhari
articles.description: Lebanese Parliament Speaker Nabih Berri reprised his role as a key interlocutor between Hezbollah and the United States as Washington sought to mediate an end to the war with Israel, drawing on decades of experience to help clinch the deal.
articles.title: Lebanon's Berri reprises key mediator role in ceasefire deal

articles.author: Joseph Ax, Helen Coster, James Oliphant
articles.description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's vow to impose tariffs on China and Mexico unless they stem the flow of fentanyl and migrants across the U.S. border could impel deeper cooperation from those governments on drug policing, experts said.
articles.title: Trump places high-risk, high-reward bet on tariffs to stem fentanyl

articles.author: Joe Cash
articles.description: The two superpowers are setting out their positions ahead of Trump's return to the White House.
articles.title: China state media warn Trump against mutually destructive tariff war
